answers.answer: If you already took it then you are fine:) you only need to take it once
Well the actual test is drinking a drink then getting blood drawn, did she give u the sugar drink?
No she just took blood the same time I took my quad test

Ok then you haven't been tested for GD yet.When you get tested for it you drink a glucose drink and then wait one hour then they draw your blood. If you fail you have to take another one that's 3 hours long instead of one hour, if you fail again they put you on a special diet for the rest of your pregnancy
I would definitely call in the morning to ask about it and possibly schedule it
Ur usually suppose to take the test around 30-32 weeks

Smh I should a known better because this is baby #3 for me! I just thought since she took blood and it came out negative I was okay and she never ever brought it up again. Idk y she didn't tho??? But thanx hun Ima most def call the office tommrw and set a lab appt up to take it. Because I don't want anything to happen to my lil one I'll b devastated
@khristal oh okay lol than for the info I was going to have some words with my doctor in the morning

I'm scheduled to take mine on the 19th, I'll be 27 weeks if I'm not mistaken.I think you'll still be in the clear by the time u take it if its done soon since a lot of women get it done around week 33.
^^true. Thanx again hun:) and good luck on your test
Thanks! I'm not worried but i ain't exactly excited either :p lol
I didn't take the test because I have constant low blood sugar . If that's how you are than you don't need to take the test because you can't possibly have diabetes .
I've read that the glucose drink has a lot of chemicals in it and some other downsides to the test. Do some research and make an informed decision on if this is somthing u really need
Friday I take my gestational diabetes test and I'll be exactly 26 weeks.

I can't see how there could be that big of a negative to taking the test when the alternative is possible still born. I wasn't excited to take it, I love something sweet probably once a week, but I'd give it up in a heartbeat if it means my child's health. Ask to take the test, my cousin developed it late pregnancy.
If you do the research, and actually look at the studies done...."there is no link between gestational diabetes and still born babies"
"In a single study of 25,000 women, researchers concluded that there was no association between gestational diabetes and infant death"Evidencebasedbirth.com
Im 22 wks and scheduled to take the GTT too .. Isnt that alittle too early?
No i don't think that's to early.you'll be fine

question: Sorry if um spelling it wrong but I read that a woman had a still birth because of untreated GD. I haven't took the testMy doctor took blood in the beginning of my pregnancy and found nothing. I'm 33weeks and 2days and that terrified me and I never wanna experience that. Am I clear because she took the test earlier in my pregnancy when I was about 14weeks or she just don't know what shes doing smh????
title: Gestional Diabetes scare
